header: **AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR: A CASE STUDY**
text:
LAURA NURSKI

This case study illustrates the drivers of and barriers to artificial intelligence adoption by organisations, and acceptance of AI by workers in the public sector.

enrichment.title: AI Adoption in Public Sector
enrichment.summary: Examines factors influencing AI adoption and worker acceptance in public sector organizations.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR: A CASE STUDY**
text:
Subsidy support mechanisms were also specifically targeted and acquired to support the adoption.

However, making AI support available to workers proved insufficient to ensure its widespread usage throughout the organisation.

enrichment.title: AI Adoption in Public Sector
enrichment.summary: Subsidy mechanisms supported AI adoption, but worker usage remained limited despite availability.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR: A CASE STUDY**

enrichment.title: AI Adoption in Public Sector
enrichment.summary: Examines AI implementation in public sector through a specific case study, highlighting challenges, benefits, and strategies for adoption.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Artificial intelligence (AI) is a new general purpose technology (GPT) expected to bring productivity gains, but also to impact the nature and quality of work.

enrichment.title: AI and productivity impact
enrichment.summary: AI, as a general purpose technology, promises productivity gains while influencing work's nature and quality.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The introduction of previous GPTs, including electricity and computers, has shown a long lag between the adoption of new technologies in the production of goods and services, and widescale observable increases in total factor productivity.

enrichment.title: Productivity and Technology Acceptance
enrichment.summary: Technological adoption, like electricity and computers, often shows delayed impacts on total factor productivity in goods and services production.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: This puzzling observation is often dubbed the *"productivity paradox"* (Landauer, 1995), ie the phenomenon that large investments in new IT technologies by firms have not been accompanied by subsequent increases in national productivity statistics.

enrichment.title: Productivity Paradox in IT Investments
enrichment.summary: The productivity paradox highlights the lack of national productivity growth despite significant IT investments by firms.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Two crucial factors in explaining this paradox are the slow adaptation of business processes and the underutilisation of technology by workers (Devaraj and Kohli, 2003).

enrichment.title: Productivity and Technology Acceptance
enrichment.summary: Slow business process adaptation and worker underutilization of technology explain productivity paradox.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: When organisational processes and incentives are not aligned with technology use, workers will not fully adopt new technologies in their work (Atkin *et al*, 2017).

enrichment.title: Productivity and technology acceptance
enrichment.summary: Misaligned organizational processes and incentives hinder workers' adoption of new technologies.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: AI applications equally suffer from such underutilisation, as studies of the banking (Xu and Zhu, 2021), retail (Kawaguchi, 2020) and healthcare (Jauk *et al*, 2021) sectors demonstrate.

enrichment.title: Productivity and technology acceptance
enrichment.summary: AI applications face underutilization in banking, retail, and healthcare sectors, as shown by recent studies.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Furthermore, it takes time, money and willingness for business models and organisational models to adapt to the use of new technology.

enrichment.title: Productivity and Technology Acceptance
enrichment.summary: Adapting business and organizational models to new technology requires time, money, and willingness.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Such adaptation requires investment in people practices or human resources (HR) practices, including training, performance evaluations and hiring (Bloom *et al*, 2012).

enrichment.title: Productivity and Technology Acceptance
enrichment.summary: Adaptation requires investment in HR practices like training, evaluations, and hiring.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Investment is also needed in organisational practices, such as business process reengineering, decentralisation or organisation redesign (Bresnahan *et al*, 2002).

enrichment.title: Productivity and Technology Acceptance
enrichment.summary: Organizational practices like reengineering, decentralization, and redesign require investment for improved productivity and technology acceptance.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: To analyse the drivers of and barriers to AI adoption by organisations, and acceptance of AI by workers, we investigate a specific case in this study.

enrichment.title: AI adoption and acceptance study
enrichment.summary: The study examines factors influencing AI adoption by organizations and acceptance by workers through a specific case analysis.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The study does not serve as a 'star case' (which demonstrates reproducible best practices) or as a 'research case' (which aims to improve economic theories of causality) (Baker and Gil, 2013).

enrichment.title: Productivity and Technology Acceptance
enrichment.summary: The study is neither a reproducible best-practice case nor aimed at improving economic causality theories.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Instead, this is a 'teaching case' that illustrates scientific theories in a practical example and bridges several disciplines (including IT, management, organisational behaviour, psychology and economics) by linking theories from respective domains in one case.

enrichment.title: Productivity and Technology Acceptance
enrichment.summary: A teaching case illustrating scientific theories across IT, management, psychology, and economics disciplines.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The goal is to identify pitfalls in the process of technology adoption and to provide some lessons for both policy and business.

enrichment.title: Productivity and technology adoption
enrichment.summary: Explores pitfalls in technology adoption and offers lessons for policy and business.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **1.2 The organisations in this case study**
text: We analyse AI adoption by Flanders Investment and Trade, a public organisation, which was assisted by Radix, a private firm[2.](#page-3-3)

enrichment.title: AI adoption by Flanders Investment and Trade
enrichment.summary: Analysis of AI adoption by Flanders Investment and Trade, supported by Radix.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **1.2 The organisations in this case study**
text: Note that throughout the paper we refer to a list of case-study materials through numerals shown in square brackets. The annex lists the case-study materials.

enrichment.title: case study organizations
enrichment.summary: The paper references case-study materials listed in the annex using numerals in square brackets.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **1.2 The organisations in this case study**
text: Their activities can be grouped into four broad categories: product and market identification and development; trade information services; specialised support services; and promotional activities abroad (Jaramillo, 1992).

enrichment.title: Organizations in Case Study
enrichment.summary: The case study categorizes organizational activities into product development, trade information, specialized support, and promotional efforts abroad.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **1.2 The organisations in this case study**
text: FIT's mission is to internationalise the economy of Flanders by assisting Flanders-based companies in their export effort ('trade') and by attracting foreign companies and investment to the region ('invest').

enrichment.title: FIT mission overview
enrichment.summary: FIT aims to internationalize Flanders' economy by supporting exports and attracting foreign investment.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **1.2 The organisations in this case study**
text: Alongside delivering trade and investment services, FIT engages in promotional and development activities including the hosting of events and publication of market insights.

enrichment.title: FIT activities overview
enrichment.summary: FIT provides trade and investment services, hosts events, and publishes market insights for promotional and development purposes.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **1.2 The organisations in this case study**
text: FIT has six regional offices in Flanders and Brussels (employing about 150 people) and 100 local offices abroad (employing about 180 people).

enrichment.title: FIT organizational structure
enrichment.summary: FIT operates six regional offices in Flanders and Brussels and 100 local offices abroad, employing approximately 330 people.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **1.2 The organisations in this case study**
text: Radix is a Belgian AI solution provider, founded in 2018. It has a team of 40 engineers and solution leads across two offices in Flanders and Brussels.

enrichment.title: Radix Case Study Overview
enrichment.summary: Radix, a Belgian AI provider founded in 2018, employs 40 engineers across offices in Flanders and Brussels.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **1.2 The organisations in this case study**
text: Radix provides a portfolio of AI solutions to improve operations in a range of industries, including manufacturing, transportation, financial services and the public sector.

enrichment.title: Radix AI solutions overview
enrichment.summary: Radix offers AI solutions to enhance operations across industries like manufacturing, transportation, finance, and the public sector.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **1.2 The organisations in this case study**
text: Flanders Investment and Trade (FIT) is the trade promotion organisation (TPO) of Flanders, a region of Belgium.TPOs are facilitative agencies that promote and stimulate trade by providing information, linkages, technical advice, marketing and policy advocacy (Giovannucci, 2004).

enrichment.title: organisations in case study
enrichment.summary: Flanders Investment and Trade (FIT) promotes trade in Flanders, Belgium, offering information, linkages, technical advice, marketing, and policy advocacy.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The case was found through the website of the AI developer (Radix), which showcases client stories. Several Radix client stories were relevant for the Future of Work and were therefore considered.

enrichment.title: case selection process
enrichment.summary: Radix client stories were reviewed for relevance to the Future of Work.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Among them were two clients in the human resources and public employment sectors: an AI-supported orientation test developed for the Flemish public employment agency, and an AI-powered jobmatching algorithm developed for a private HR services company.

enrichment.title: AI in HR and Employment
enrichment.summary: AI tools were developed for job orientation and matching in public and private employment sectors.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: AI will likely play a major role in matching job seekers to job vacancies in the labour markets of the future.

enrichment.title: AI in Future Labour Markets
enrichment.summary: AI is expected to significantly enhance job matching in future labour markets.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: However, in this particular case study, the goal is to study AI not in the job-matching process, but in the production process itself.

enrichment.title: AI in Production Process
enrichment.summary: The case study examines AI's role in the production process rather than job-matching.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: FIT was highlighted as a Radix client that adopted AI in one of their core business activities: answering trade-related questions from Flemish companies looking to do trade abroad.

enrichment.title: FIT AI adoption case
enrichment.summary: FIT utilized AI to assist Flemish companies with trade-related inquiries for international business activities.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Other client cases of this AI developer with applications in the production process included: a production planning algorithm that improves on-time-delivery of production orders, taking less time than a human planner;

enrichment.title: case selection overview
enrichment.summary: AI developer's production planning algorithm enhances on-time delivery and efficiency compared to human planners.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: an algorithm that improves vaccine development by counting and reporting colony forming units; and an algorithm that automatically tags new articles of a news supplier with topical hashtags.

enrichment.title: case selection algorithms
enrichment.summary: Algorithms for vaccine development and news article tagging are highlighted as case examples.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: We selected the question-answering algorithm for FIT over these other examples because it fitted the current narrative of AI replacing routine cognitive tasks of knowledge workers.

enrichment.title: case selection rationale
enrichment.summary: The question-answering algorithm was chosen for FIT due to its alignment with AI replacing routine cognitive tasks of knowledge workers.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Another reason was that the developer noted in their FIT client profile both productivity increases (27 percent time savings, 36 percent more questions answered) and job satisfaction improvements (focus on more complex cases and other parts of their jobs) [8 – see the annex], which fitted our goal of studying both productivity and jobquality effects.

enrichment.title: case selection rationale
enrichment.summary: The case was selected due to noted productivity increases and job satisfaction improvements aligning with study goals on productivity and job quality effects.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Both the opportunities and 1 Se[e https://www.bruegel.org/future-work/future-work-and-inclusive-growth-europe.](https://www.bruegel.org/future-work/future-work-and-inclusive-growth-europe) 2 Se[e https://welcome.flandersinvestmentandtrade.com/](https://welcome.flandersinvestmentandtrade.com/) an[d https://radix.ai/.](https://radix.ai/) potential dangers of this application are currently being studied and debated widely, with specific focus on the risk of increasing discrimination in the labour market.

enrichment.title: Case Selection Risks in Labor Market
enrichment.summary: The application’s opportunities and risks, including potential labor market discrimination, are being studied and debated.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The case was studied through the collection and analysis of several data sources. First, desk research was performed on the existing scientific theories and evidence on AI adoption and acceptance.

enrichment.title: Methodology Overview
enrichment.summary: The study utilized desk research to analyze scientific theories and evidence on AI adoption and acceptance.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: This desk research resulted in the publication of several blog posts and papers on these topics (see for example Hoffman and Nurski, 2021a, 2021b).

enrichment.title: Methodology Overview
enrichment.summary: Desk research led to the publication of blog posts and papers on related topics.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Second, desk research was carried out on publicly available information on the cases, most notably the respective websites of FIT and Radix.

enrichment.title: Methodology Overview
enrichment.summary: Desk research utilized publicly available information, including websites of FIT and Radix.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: In a third step, interview guides were developed on the topics on technology adoption and acceptance for several interviewee targets.

enrichment.title: Methodology Overview
enrichment.summary: Interview guides were created to explore technology adoption and acceptance among various target groups.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Interviews were conducted with FIT's AI lead and HR lead (see [4], [10], [13]) and with four 'end users' of one specific AI application at FIT, also known as 'case handlers' (see [12]).

enrichment.title: methodology overview
enrichment.summary: Interviews were conducted with FIT's AI and HR leads, and four end users of a specific AI application.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The four end users (two men and two women) were stationed in four different offices: France, Germany, Italy and the USA.

enrichment.title: Methodology Overview
enrichment.summary: Four end users were stationed in offices across France, Germany, Italy, and the USA.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Depending on the internal organisation of the office, some of the interviewees specialised in certain regions of their country, while others specialised in certain industries in that country.

enrichment.title: Methodology Overview
enrichment.summary: Interviewees specialized in regions or industries within their country based on office organization.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: A final data source consisted of collected documents, including slide decks, screenshots and training materials. The full list of case study materials can be found in the annex.

enrichment.title: methodology overview
enrichment.summary: Documents, including slide decks and training materials, were collected as a data source for case studies.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: As part of its digital innovation strategy (see section 2.2.1), FIT is adopting AI across a range of activities in its primary services, namely the trade and invest services.

enrichment.title: FIT Digital Innovation Timeline
enrichment.summary: FIT integrates AI into its trade and invest services as part of its digital innovation strategy.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Over four years (2017 to 2021), FIT went through three AI project cycles to: (1) experiment with proof-of-concepts (POCs), (2) build an AI strategy, and (3) set-up the necessary data infrastructure.

enrichment.title: FIT AI Project Timeline
enrichment.summary: FIT completed three AI project cycles from 2017 to 2021, focusing on POCs, strategy development, and data infrastructure setup.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: In the first phase, FIT familiarised itself with AI technology to discover opportunities and investigate whether it would be useful to explore further.

enrichment.title: AI Proof-of-Concept Development
enrichment.summary: FIT explored AI technology to identify opportunities and assess its potential during the first phase from 2017 to 2019.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: An external AI agency (Radix) set up a 'fast discovery workshop' for FIT's AI lead to screen FIT's business processes for potential AI opportunities [7].

enrichment.title: AI proof-of-concepts development phase
enrichment.summary: Radix conducted a workshop to identify AI opportunities in FIT's business processes between 2017-2019.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: This workshop consisted of a series of brainstorming exercises between the AI developer and the organisation looking to adopt AI.

enrichment.title: AI Proof-of-Concept Development
enrichment.summary: Brainstorming exercises were conducted between AI developers and organizations adopting AI during Phase 1 (2017-2019).

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The methodology for building the AI strategy consisted of three building blocks. First, an enterprise architecture was drawn up, mapping the current business processes on applications, data layers and technical systems.

enrichment.summary: The AI strategy was developed using enterprise architecture to map business processes, applications, data layers, and technical systems.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Second, an AI maturity assessment was conducted to assess the 'as-is' state of AI maturity and to develop an AI roadmap of potential 'to-be' states of AI adoption.

enrichment.title: AI strategy building phase
enrichment.summary: An AI maturity assessment evaluated the current state and created a roadmap for future AI adoption.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The third part of the AI strategy related to training and human resources. It included setting up an AI unit responsible for AI impact and dissemination at FIT, training everyone at FIT on basic AI literacy, and specific training for the digital marketing team on data-driven marketing strategies and tools.

enrichment.title: AI strategy phase 2 (2020)
enrichment.summary: Phase 2 focused on AI training, establishing an AI unit, and enhancing digital marketing team skills at FIT.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text:
- AI Novice: AI novices have not taken proactive steps on the AI journey and, at best, are in assessment mode.
- AI Ready: Sufficiently prepared to implement AI in terms of strategy, organisational set-up and data availability.
- AI Proficient: A reasonable degree of practical experience and understanding of how to move forward with AI. There are still gaps and limitations.
- AI Advanced: A good level of AI expertise and experience, with a proven track record across a range of use cases. Good operational procedures in place.

enrichment.title: AI Strategy Phases
enrichment.summary: Defines four AI maturity levels: novice, ready, proficient, and advanced, based on preparedness, experience, and operational procedures.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The AI roadmap towards the to-be state was drawn up to move through three states. In a first stage, FIT would use self-service business analytics[4](#page-8-0) and dashboarding apps (such as Power BI and Azure data services) and ready-made AI supported insights (for example Office 365 workplace analytics) to build a data foundation and support a data-driven decision-making culture.

enrichment.title: AI strategy development phase
enrichment.summary: FIT planned an AI roadmap emphasizing self-service analytics, dashboarding apps, and AI-supported insights to establish a data-driven decision-making culture.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: In a second stage, FIT could use solution-specific AI services and AI-based content understanding (for example chatbots and Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) to Natural Language Processing (NLP) models) to build an FIT conversational knowledge platform.

enrichment.title: Building an AI Strategy
enrichment.summary: FIT plans to develop a conversational knowledge platform using AI services and NLP models.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Finally, in the third stage, FIT could adopt advanced cloud infrastructures and open machine-learning frameworks, as well as develop their own custom data science and deep AI capabilities to support the digital marketing pipeline (for example on targeted ads, leads and direct marketing).

enrichment.title: Building AI Strategy Phase 2
enrichment.summary: FIT may adopt advanced cloud and AI tools to enhance digital marketing through targeted ads, leads, and direct marketing.

text: Answering 'trade cases' is one of the core business activities of FIT. doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **3.2 Framework for user acceptance and actual use**
text: To analyse user acceptance of the AI at FIT, we used the Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology model (see Figure 3 and Venkatesh *et al*, 2003) from the information systems literature[6](#page-14-1).

enrichment.title: AI User Acceptance Framework
enrichment.summary: The Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology model was applied to analyze AI user acceptance at FIT.

entities.text: Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **3.2 Framework for user acceptance and actual use**
text: In this model, actual uptake of new technologies is driven by a user's intention to use, and facilitating conditions for use.

enrichment.title: User Acceptance Framework
enrichment.summary: User acceptance and technology use depend on intention and facilitating conditions.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
header: **3.2 Framework for user acceptance and actual use**
text:
Facilitating conditions include adequate support infrastructure and assistance.The behavioural intention to use technology is called the user 'acceptance'. This acceptance is shaped by how the user perceives the technology's usefulness and its ease of use and any influence of the social environment of the user. Perceived usefulness is defined as *"the degree to which a person believes that using a particular system would enhance his or her job performance"* and perceived ease-of-use is defined as *"the degree to which a person believes that using a particular system would be free from effort"* (Davis, 1989).

![](_page_14_Figure_3.jpeg)

enrichment.title: User Acceptance Framework
enrichment.summary: User acceptance depends on perceived usefulness, ease of use, and social influence, supported by adequate infrastructure and assistance.

text: show what AI is. I even remember a meeting where a colleague burst into tears because she read so much in the media about AI and was really frightened by it.

enrichment.title: AI Lead Interview
enrichment.summary: A colleague expressed fear about AI after reading alarming media coverage during a meeting.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Then we also gave a presentation about the media's perception of AI compared to the reality and where we are going.

enrichment.title: AI Media Perception Presentation
enrichment.summary: Presentation compared media's perception of AI with its reality and future direction.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text:
[…]That did do a lot of good.

The IT department also has regular meetings with the business departments which also focussed a lot on joint communication efforts.

enrichment.title: Interview with AI Lead
enrichment.summary: IT and business departments collaborate through regular meetings to enhance communication efforts.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: We have a business-IT department meeting, which includes a number of IT representatives and a number of people delegated from the business department.

enrichment.title: Business-IT Meeting Overview
enrichment.summary: A meeting involves IT representatives and business department delegates discussing collaboration.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: A lot of emphasis is put on communication in this meeting. How are we going to communicate this? There is now a new change, how should we communicate it?

enrichment.title: Communication Strategy Discussion
enrichment.summary: The meeting emphasizes effective communication strategies for addressing a new change.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: […] We find that it is super important. We can develop the best applications, but if we don't communicate well, they won't be used and it's almost lost money.

enrichment.title: Interview AI Lead Insights
enrichment.summary: Effective communication is crucial for application adoption and avoiding wasted resources.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: On the side of organisational development, parts of the central IT support function were decentralised, ie some tech support tasks were moved from a central organisational entity to the frontline teams.

enrichment.title: Organisational IT Decentralisation
enrichment.summary: Central IT support tasks were decentralised, moving some responsibilities to frontline teams for improved organisational development.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: This included some IT support to FIT's own employees (employee tech support) in the form of new roles of 'key users' that could act as first contact points the use of internal digital tools including the CRM and the AI.

enrichment.title: FIT IT Support Roles
enrichment.summary: FIT introduced 'key users' to support employees with internal digital tools like CRM and AI.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The decentralisation also included the IT support provided to FIT's external clients when using digital tools such as question forms or event registrations (customer tech support).

enrichment.title: Decentralised IT Support for FIT Clients
enrichment.summary: FIT decentralised IT support for external clients using digital tools like question forms and event registrations.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: This decision clearly made the support infrastructure and assistance more accessible (ie addressing the 'facilitating conditions' driver in the technology acceptance framework in section 3.2).

enrichment.title: Interview AI lead
enrichment.summary: The decision improved support infrastructure and assistance, addressing facilitating conditions in the technology acceptance framework.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: "We have two positions now in which people are going to be facilitators for teaching those tools. They will take on a senior role in that function and in that senior role

enrichment.title: HR Interview Facilitator Roles
enrichment.summary: Two senior facilitator positions are available for teaching tools and taking on leadership roles.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: they will also be expected to ensure that the team is involved in the usage of tools. This way, adoption by the users can take place in the team itself, so not from a support service or from the project, but from the group itself."

enrichment.title: Team Tool Adoption Strategy
enrichment.summary: Encourage team-led adoption of tools to avoid reliance on external support services or projects.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: there can also be shifted slightly to the front line [ie the case handlers]. Certain questions from companies that are now handled by IT

enrichment.title: HR Interview Insights
enrichment.summary: Shifting case handling responsibilities from IT to frontline case handlers is discussed.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Such rewards could for example include a solar-powered power bank for charging mobile phones and laptops. This reward system aimed to align incentives between the employer and its employees; award social status to digital tool usage; and install a social norm for tool usage that had been missing in the organisation so far (ie addressing 'social influence' driver in in the technology acceptance framework in section 3.2).

enrichment.title: HR Interview Rewards System
enrichment.summary: Rewards like solar-powered power banks were used to align incentives, promote digital tool usage, and establish social norms within the organization.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text:
Interview HR:

"Then on the organisational development side, we are setting up a business IT helpdesk so that the focus of IT and the workload

enrichment.title: HR Interview Organizational Development
enrichment.summary: The organization is establishing a business IT helpdesk to optimize IT focus and workload management.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text:
can then be taught in the front line."

Finally on the individual learning and development side, beyond the training plans that were designed for each of the different groups of employees (see section 2.2.3), HR also set up a reward system that rewards employees in non-monetary terms for achieving milestones in digital tool usage.

enrichment.title: HR Interview Insights
enrichment.summary: HR implemented training plans and a non-monetary reward system to encourage employee milestones in digital tool usage.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: "This reward system is put into the learning path, every time a milestone is achieved in learning the tool, to motivate them.

enrichment.title: Learning Path Reward System
enrichment.summary: A reward system motivates learners by celebrating milestones achieved during tool training.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: the usefulness of the AI or other digital support tools, in terms of task relevance, output quality and results demonstrability (in in the technology acceptance framework of [3.2)](#page-14-0).

enrichment.title: AI in HR Interviews
enrichment.summary: Discusses AI and digital tools' relevance, quality, and demonstrability within a technology acceptance framework.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text:
If they have X number of points, they can exchange that for a gift."

The final step they arrived at – at the moment when this case study was conducted – was to really focus on addressing (the perception of)

enrichment.title: HR Interview Insights
enrichment.summary: Points can be exchanged for gifts; focus on addressing perceptions during the case study's final step.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: "I am now on the path of Jane Hart [holistic Learning & Development guru, ed.]. How can we get employees to use our tools?

enrichment.title: Interview HR on employee tool adoption
enrichment.summary: Discusses strategies for encouraging employees to utilize organizational tools effectively.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: […] Basically, the bottom line is that we really need to go to impact and start from there to effectively move people towards acceptance."

enrichment.title: HR Interview Insights
enrichment.summary: Emphasizes starting with impact to drive acceptance effectively.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: This case study shows how AI support in frontline processes does not necessarily have to displace or control workers. Some crucial factors in successfully adopting a human-centred approach to AI were identified.

enrichment.title: AI in frontline processes
enrichment.summary: AI can support frontline processes without displacing workers, emphasizing human-centered adoption factors.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: First, a 'fast-discovery' phase – including the development of fully operational proofs-ofconcept – can facilitate the trialability of AI, ie the ability to experiment with an innovation before fully committing to it.

enrichment.title: AI Fast-Discovery Phase
enrichment.summary: A fast-discovery phase with proofs-of-concept enables experimentation with AI innovations before full commitment.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: This in turn reduces uncertainty and facilitates adoption. Second, workers' assessments of the potential productivity gains and the current data availability are crucial for assessing both the technical complexity and business value of the opportunities, even before any development takes place.

enrichment.title: Conclusion and recommendations
enrichment.summary: Reducing uncertainty aids adoption; workers' evaluations of productivity gains and data availability are key for assessing technical complexity and business value pre-development.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Involvement of workers in the evaluation and improvement of the early concepts also significantly increase the quality of the algorithm after the first minimum viable product are released.

enrichment.title: Worker involvement improves algorithm quality
enrichment.summary: Engaging workers in evaluation and improvement enhances algorithm quality post-minimum viable product release.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Third, it is important to involve human resources managers in the process of technology adoption early on, to facilitate the alignment between HR processes, IT processes and business processes from the start.

enrichment.title: HR involvement in tech adoption
enrichment.summary: Early involvement of HR managers ensures alignment between HR, IT, and business processes during technology adoption.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Finally, financial support from diverse European and national subsidy channels (specifically the EU's SRSP and ERDF programmes) were specifically targeted to assist in the adoption of AI.

enrichment.title: AI adoption funding recommendations
enrichment.summary: European and national subsidies, including SRSP and ERDF, supported AI adoption.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: As this case study has also demonstrated, making AI support available to workers is not sufficient to ensure its widespread usage throughout the organisation.

enrichment.title: AI support adoption challenges
enrichment.summary: AI support availability alone does not guarantee widespread organizational usage.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: More experienced workers in particular were not very inclined to make much use of the algorithm, mostly because they had less need for the AI support.

enrichment.title: Conclusion on AI use by experienced workers
enrichment.summary: Experienced workers showed limited use of the algorithm due to reduced need for AI support.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: A bigger barrier to worker acceptance is the usefulness of a new technology for a specific task to a worker.

enrichment.title: Worker Acceptance of Technology
enrichment.summary: Worker acceptance depends on the perceived usefulness of new technology for specific tasks.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The potential of AI to support work is usually framed in relation to the routineness of tasks, but as this case study has shown, it also needs to be assessed in the context of worker experience and task allocations (or work divisions) among workers.

enrichment.title: AI and Work Allocation
enrichment.summary: AI's impact on work depends on task routineness, worker experience, and task allocation among workers.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: Depending on the interplay between task routineness and worker experience, the new technology might necessitate a rethinking of the work division between technology and workers on the other hand, and junior and senior workers on the other hand.

enrichment.title: Work Division and Technology Impact
enrichment.summary: New technology may require reevaluating work division between technology, workers, and varying experience levels.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: These investments go beyond training in digital skills. They are investments into the redesign of organisational processes that are necessary to reap the benefits of new technologies.

enrichment.title: Conclusion on Digital Investments
enrichment.summary: Investments extend beyond digital skills training to include redesigning organizational processes for leveraging new technologies.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: These types of investments are currently poorly captured in company balance sheets (Brynjolfsson *et al*, 2021) and as such, we have poor information about intangibles in national accounts as well.

enrichment.title: Investments in Intangibles
enrichment.summary: Intangible investments are poorly represented in company balance sheets and national accounts, limiting available information.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: In order to stimulate research and understanding in this area, it would be advisable to adapt accounting standards to capture firms' intangible investments in their people and organisations.

enrichment.title: Conclusion on accounting standards adaptation
enrichment.summary: Adapting accounting standards to include intangible investments in people and organizations is recommended to enhance research and understanding.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text: The technology needs to be seamlessly integrated into workflows to persuade workers to optimally use it.This is a technology design issue that is well understood – also well recognised by the participants in this case – and can be easily addressed.

enrichment.title: Technology Integration Recommendations
enrichment.summary: Seamless integration of technology into workflows is crucial for optimal usage and can be easily addressed as a design issue.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text:
Contrary to the beforementioned technology design issue, this is an organisational design issue.

Successful human-centred AI adoption will therefore depend on the availability of investments in complementary intangible organisational capital.

enrichment.title: AI Adoption Recommendations
enrichment.summary: Human-centred AI adoption requires investments in complementary intangible organizational capital for success.

doc: AI ADOPTION IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR_concepts_full
text:
This includes both individual people-management processes, like

hiring, performance evaluations and reward systems, and organisational development processes including business process reengineering and organisational redesign.

enrichment.title: Conclusion and recommendations
enrichment.summary: Discusses people-management and organizational development processes, including hiring, evaluations, rewards, reengineering, and redesign.
